title: A surprising way to lose your file in Git
text:
In the spirit of the recent: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=33047150 here is how git can eat your file:

We make a new directory, initialize a Git repo there:

  $ mkdir git-test
  $ cd git-test
  git-test$ git init
  Initialized empty Git repository in /home/kaz/git-test/.git/
Now we create a file and stage it for addition:

  git-test$ echo content > file
  git-test$ git add file
We can see it in the dir listing, of course:

  git-test$ ls
  file
And see the diff between the stage and the index, which adds the file:

  git-test$ git diff --cached
  diff --git a/file b/file
  new file mode 100644
  index 0000000..d95f3ad
  --- /dev/null
  +++ b/file
  @@ -0,0 +1 @@
  +content
Now, we do a git reset --hard to eliminate the staging:

  git-test $ git reset --hard
Where is the working file?

  git-test $ ls
  git-test $
Oops!

title: Show HN: ShopMe – Combine all of your e-commerce wishlists into one
text:
Hey everyone!

My name is Jerome and I'm the Founder of ShopMe (www.getshopme.com).

Originally, ShopMe was an app that let you scan items in physical stores and it would tell you if you can find that item somewhere else more cheaply. After some feedback though, we found out that the biggest problem of our target users is managing their wishlists.

74% of people who buy online maintain some kind of wishlist to keep track of things that they want to buy but they end up creating too many lists across multiple sites. There's no easy way for them to consolidate it so they forget items and lose out on deals.

We (re)built ShopMe to address just that. You can create a universal wishlist - add individual items via product links or barcodes and even import WHOLE wishlists from most major ecommerce sites (just make sure they're public). Get price drop notifications and when you're ready to order, just put it in your ShopMe cart and order with one click (even with multiple items across different sites).

We were in private beta for a few months but we just launched on Product Hunt. If you're the type that has multiple wishlists, do try it out!

Show HN: A pure rust discord bot hosted on Cloudflare workers
text:
Hi HN,

I've made a discord bot template that you can clone and create your own bots.

It's a serverless bot hosted on cloudflare workers which looks like a great use case for this sort of thing.

Using workers you have almost zero (<5ms) cold start time for your functions. With a free account you get up to 100k requests per day and you can store/access state using KV or durable objects.

Workers only support Javascript and WASM in their runtime. This bot is writter in pure rust which compiles to WASM and deploys your worker with a simple CLI command.

I've made a couple of bots using this template, mainly for stitching together rest APIs and the response times are pretty great.

That's all, thanks!

Ask HN: Extreme Project Management?
text:
I am looking for a methodology to run multiple projects with less resources. I was thinking XP for project management. Did a search and there is something called Extreme Project Management XPM.

I found a few books out there on the topic. I am curious to know what has been your experience with this XPM methodology if you have used it or worked in a team where it was used?
